body_html:
In my macbookpro, I expanded my DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH as follows to get around this issue.
cant verify further as the macbook I tried this on is now a brick, but I hope this helps:

export DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH=/Developer/NVIDIA/CUDA-8.0:/Developer/NVIDIA/CUDA-8.0/lib:/usr/local/cuda:/usr/local/cuda/lib:$DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH

We seem to be resolving some libraries with the lib in the path and some without.
That seems to be causing the problem.

body:
In my macbookpro, I expanded my `DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH` as follows to get around this issue.
cant verify further as the macbook I tried this on is now a brick, but I hope this helps:
```
export DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH=/Developer/NVIDIA/CUDA-8.0:/Developer/NVIDIA/CUDA-8.0/lib:/usr/local/cuda:/usr/local/cuda/lib:$DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH
```

We seem to be resolving some libraries with the `lib` in the path and some without.
That seems to be causing the problem.
